part.narration: Nozomi points down the hallway in the direction of the studio Yuki now leads. Yuki walks. Nozomi spouts:
part.line: While you were sleeping, the game industry was dying.
Since the recession, all of Japan's major video game corporations merged into a single superpower.
All but us. We and the Parisian-Nagoyan Network were the resistance...
part.narration: Priorities. The situation precedes the explanation. Yuki plows ahead.
part.line: ...sorry about being a parasite, I just couldn't handle a whole studio, I didn't know what I was getting into...
...I'm just a concept artist...Sonic Adventure Portable...quick buck...
...you must think it weird for us to hire you so, but if it weren't for your dad...
...dead...
This is my company.
part.narration: Yuki stands at the door. Eyes closed, smiling wide. She looks at it. She looks at Nozomi. She puts her hand on the knob. She pushes the door open.

Battlefield. Misled software development. Document shrapnel. Segfault bullets. Exception artillery. Yelling. Screaming. Fear. Yuki takes a few steps and trips, her face landing near an old, decrepit binder. It's an application design document, like every other in the room.The first instance of a deprecated design document.
part.line: What—

narration.comment: As in normal gameplay, the binder begins to beep. The Player has three seconds to have Yuki disperse.

part.line: Get out of the way!

choice.comment: Yuki doesn't get out of the way in time...
choice.narration: Yuki is blinded by the document's explosion of misinformation.

choice.comment: Yuki does get out of the way in time...
choice.narration: Yuki is deafened by the document's explosion of misinformation.

part.narration: Yuki in gaze. She watch scene.If the Player tries to move, Yuki stumbles around.Man is yelling at a phone.
part.line: Dan, here!
I need every last header file refactored!
Yes, throw away every single base class!
The sound library wrappers are incompatible with—
part.narration: In the distance, explosions. Dan Yoshizaki at them winces. A large man grabs him and fireman-carries him across.
part.line: Leave me here!
I said leave me here, dammit!
I told you to leave me, Ganpu!
Forget about me, get yourself out!
Did you hear what I said?
part.narration: Nozomi fireman carries Yuki and drops her near the studio director's desk. Yuki clears her throat and looks around.
part.line: Stop!
Now I run this studio—
Damn it.
Is she French too? The CEO must have a hard-on for Pommes.
It's an omen. This child will be the death of us.
Listen!
So I am Sega's death.
But so long as I rule, we will live harder than we have ever lived before.
I will follow you to the ends of the earth, Yuki!
See? At least one of you has some damn sense.
Alas, one artist does not a team make.
Neither do either of any of you.
What we need is order. Rules. Guidelines. Standards.
One. We will write three games. No more, no less. Three games.
part.comment: The "game" drop-down menu appears. There are no tick-marks on it.
part.line: Two. We operate on fluctuating but stable schedules. Nobody gets fired. Only temporarily reserved.
Three. Everyone, everyone, everyone, writes documents.
Four. Every worker maintains every machine.
Time nor nature are on our side.
We will work quickly and economically. We have little to no income.
Rest well, soldiers. Software development is not a game.
Work begins on Monday.
part.comment: The date display appears. It shifts into the calendar. Frequent sudden shifts over activities over the weekend. Yuki buys some decent food. Yuki renews her cellphone service. Yuki buys a pink notebook. Yuki is an Air Traffic Controller. Sudden cut.
